result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlos Levall Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Neglecting a Child [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Neglecting a Child [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Neglecting a Child [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 02/26/2016 @ 1:30pm.

*Probation review hearing August 26, 2016 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 24.

miscConds.notes: AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3, AND 4: Provide DNA surcharge; pay surcharge. Pay all court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION ARE  AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 AND 3:
- Mental health assessment, comply with all recommended treatment.
- Successfully complete Batterers Intervention Programming.
- Successfully complete a parenting class.
- Cooperate fully with probation agent.

No illegal drugs or alcohol.
No contact with the victims except as authorized by Children's Court; cooperate with all of their Orders.
AODA assessment. Comply with treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random screens.

*8/26/2016  Honorable Janet Protaxiewicz-Order for Commitment signed/filed.  To serve 10 days straight time.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Carlos Levall Hill in court with attorney Brian Burke.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Carlos Levall Hill in court with attorney Brian Burke.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.  Probation Agent is in court. Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is somewhat compliant with probation. Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Condtions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed (10 days straight time). The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Count one, per Order signed on 6/3/2016.

Attorney Brian Burke in court.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent in court. CMC. Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed (10 days straight time). Further review needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Count one, Per entry of 2/26/2016.

Defendant Carlos Levall Hill in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 3 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed. Further Probation Review hearing needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Carlos Levall Hill in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Carlos Levall Hill in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 5 AND 6:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNTS 1,2,3 AND 4:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
*
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements made as to sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 0 days served.  Court ordered 1 YEAR Initial Term Of Confinement and 1 YEAR Extended Supervision.
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 0 days served.  Court ordered 1 YEAR Initial Term Of Confinement and 1 YEAR Extended Supervision.
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 0 days served.  Court ordered 1 YEAR Initial Term Of Confinement and 1 YEAR Extended Supervision.
.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
.
Court IMPOSED BUT STAYED the Sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 3 years with the following conditions:
-Defendant to serve 60  in the House of Correction, STAYED until next court date.
-Mental health assessment, comply with all recommended treatment.
-Successfully complete Batterer's Intervention Programming.
-Successfully complete a parenting class.
-AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
-Absolute sobriety-no illegal drugs or alcohol.
-Random screens.
-No Contact with the victims except as authorized by Children's Court; cooperate with all of their orders.
-Cooperate fully with probation agent.
-Maintain full time employment.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
.
AS TO COUNT 4:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 50 days time served.  
.
Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.

Attorney Leah R. Thomas in court, defendant Carlos Levall Hill not in court, in custody.  Matthew Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing. Court ordered case adjourned in branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
